p:
Hinterding et al.
115 isolated pepticinnamin E ( 96) from secondary metabolites of Streptomyces sp. It is the first Ras protein substrate competition inhibitor derived from natural products. What is more, subsequent studies show that it is a dual substrate (Ras protein and FPP) competition inhibitor (IC 50 = 42 μM)
34
,
115
,
116 . Structurally, compound 96 mimics the two substrates of FTase, CAAX, and FPP.
